knimeNode.name: Abner Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: Filters terms with biomedical named entity tags not specified as valid.

fullDescription.intro:
Filters all terms contained in the given bag of words (input table) that have biomedical named entity (BNER) tags assigned which are not specified as valid. The terms are filtered out of the bag of words and the documents as well if deep preprocessing is checked.
To detect biomedical named entities, the ABNER (A Biomedical Named Entity Recognizer) Software is used (see http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~bsettles/abner/ for details).
A term is kept if at least one of its assigned BNER tags is a valid tag. If strict filtering is set, all assigned BNER tags of a term have to be valid.
fullDescription.option: If strict filtering is checked, all tags (of a certain type) of the term have to be valid. If setting is not checked, at least one tag has to be valid.
The tags to use as valid tags.
Specifies the column containing the documents to preprocess.
If deep preprocessing is checked, the terms contained inside the documents are converted too, this means that the documents are changed, which is more time consuming.

If append original document is checked, the documents contained in the input document column are appended as extra column. This enables later on a mapping of preprocessed documents to original documents.

dataIn.name: Terms and related documents input table

ports.dataIn: The input table which contains the terms to filter.

dataOut.name: Filtered terms and related documents output table

ports.dataOut: The output table which contains the filtered terms.
